label: 院北面
対訳語: North-Facing Warriors of the Ex-Sovereign's Government
本: Early Japanese History c. 40 B.C.-A.D. 1167,  Part B . Princeton University Press . 1937
説明文: Another name for the Hokumen-no-bushi (North-Facing Warriors ). A group of warriors (bushi) who acted as the guards of the Ex-Sovereign (In ), corresponding to the troops of the Headquarters of the Guards (Efu) of the Sovereign (Tennō ). Called North-Facing" because the ruler always faced southward, so his warriors standing in front of him always faced toward the north. [北面武士、武士、院、衛府、天皇]"
